text: OSA: Abscence of breathing (>10s) during sleep despite continuing respiratory effort, usually due to transcient closure of the upper airway (pharynx) Definitions vary to society: Apnoea: Cessation of airflow or a decrease in flow >90% for >10s (2 breaths or more) Hypopnoea: Decreased in flow >50% or >30% for >10s + 3% to 4% decreased in saturations or EEG evidence of arousal. Central apnoea = Absence of airway flow + respiratory effort Obstructive apnoea = Absence of airway flow + presence of respiratory effort
